content.question: Relative to the ground, an object is moving rightward with a speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Three observers each have a different constant velocity relative to the ground as follows: Observer <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is at rest, Observer <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is moving rightward at <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, and Observer <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is moving downward at <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Which of the observers, if any, will measure the kinetic energy of the object to be the greatest?

choices.label: All three observers measure the kinetic energy of the object to be the same.
